client_profile: Couple looking to buy an apartment in Brussels. Budget is 490,000–895,000 EUR. Priorities include cafes, restaurants, expat community, and central access.
red_flags: Potential noise issues in busy areas.
contradictions: Desire for central access vs. need for quiet.

top_districts.name: Ixelles

microhoods.name: Boondael
microhoods.why: Great vibe with parks and cafes near Flagey Square.
microhoods.watch_out: Busy streets can lead to noise during weekends.

microhoods.name: Universite
microhoods.why: Lively area with excellent transit access and cafes.
microhoods.watch_out: Rental demand can push prices up quickly.

why: Offers a vibrant atmosphere with plenty of cafes around Châtelain.
Strong expat community ensures diversity and cultural engagement.
watch_out: Noise from nightlife can be disruptive on weekends.

microhoods.name: Chaussee de Wavre - Saint - Julien
microhoods.why: Lively area-focused hubs with dining and recreation options.

microhoods.why: Excellent transport links with a growing expat population.
